bind(_:to:)
rawIndexableTextContent: Synchronizes model state to view state via two-way bindings.  A binding from model state. E.g., a binding derived from a field on an observable class. A binding from view state. E.g., a focus binding. Discussion SwiftUI comes with many property wrappers that can be used in views to drive view state, like field focus. Unfortunately, these property wrappers must be used in views. It’s not possible to extract this logic to an @Observable class and integrate it with the rest of the model’s business logic, and be in a better position to test this state. We can work around these limitations by introducing a published field to your observable object and synchronizing it to view state with this view modifier.
summary: Synchronizes model state to view state via two-way bindings.

rawIndexableTextContent: Returns a point along the line defined by start and end.  The starting point of the line. The ending point of the line. A factor determining the point’s position along the line. When t = 0, the result is start. When t = 1, the result is end. Values less than 0 or greater than 1 will extrapolate beyond the line segment. Return Value A point along the line defined by start and end.
title: pointAlong(from:to:t:)

title: TwoPartRange
summary: The first Substring is reserved for the full match. The subsequent three can be used in whatever way makes sense. E.g. for content surrounded by syntax, such as *italics*.
rawIndexableTextContent: The first Substring is reserved for the full match. The subsequent three can be used in whatever way makes sense. E.g. for content surrounded by syntax, such as *italics*.  Discussion In that example, substrings 2, 3 and 4 would hold the leading asterisk, text content, and trailing asterisk respectively. public typealias ThreePartRegex = Regex<(Substring, Substring, Substring, Substring)>

A brief overview of syntax types support by this editor Headings  Underline-style headings considered for possible future support:  Layout Block (single line) Syntax Leading Single-line Block types may span multiple lines only when wrapping. Otherwise, a new line signifies the start of a new markdown element.  Bold and italic  Layout Inline Emphasis style Asterisk (*) and underscore (_) Syntax Enclosed (symmetrical)  Other inline styles  Layout Inline Syntax Enclosed (symmetrical)  Lists Unordered lists  Ordered lists  Task lists  Mixed styles / nesting  Layout Block (single line) Syntax Leading  Quotes  Layout Block (single line) Syntax Leading  Links and images  Layout Inline Syntax Enclosed (asymmetrical)  Code blocks  Layout Block (multi-line) Syntax Enclosed (asymmetrical)  Horizontal rule  Layout Block Syntax
title: Markdown Syntax
summary: A brief overview of syntax types support by this editor

rawIndexableTextContent: A protocol that defines types capable of generating random values.  Overview Types conforming to RandomGeneratable must implement a method to generate random values based on specified parameters and a random number generator. The associated Value type must conform to BinaryFloatingPoint to ensure compatibility with floating-point random operations.
title: RandomGeneratable
summary: A protocol that defines types capable of generating random values.
